amendment.description: To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to the authority of States or other taxing jurisdictions to tax certain income of employees for employment duties performed in other States or taxing jurisdictions.

vote.text: Amendment SA 52 as modified agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 52 proposed by Senator Thune. (consideration: CR S435; text as modified: CR S435) To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund relating to the authority of States or other taxing jurisdictions to tax certain income of employees for employment duties performed in other States or taxing jurisdictions.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 52 as modified agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 52 proposed by Senator Thune.
